info.name: Google Books Api Test
info.description:
## This collection challenges Google Books API ##

Complete documentation of the API can be found [here](https://developers.google.com/books/docs/overview)

The API introduces 2 entities :
- VOLUMES
- BOOKSHELVES

This automated test collection challenges both of them.

### Collection structure ###
Collection is separated in 2 parts :
- **INTEGRATION TESTS :**
Challenges atomic fonctionalities
- **REGRESSION TESTS :**
Challenges global use case scenario

#### Test naming : ####
- Each test is referred as ```[SxxxCyyy] <description>```
    - ```Sxxx``` : is the id of the scenario from 0 to 999,
    - ```Cyyy``` : is the id of the test Case from 0 to 999,
    - ```<description>``` : exposes what the test case challenges and expects
    - example : ```[S101C002] Response object has all expected properties```

- Test scenarios (gherkin) and cases details are exposed in each request documentation
- Client consuming the API is referred to as ```client```
- Google books API is referred to as ```service```

#### Datas : ####
- This collection uses an external data file.

#### Auth : ####
- For ```Volumes``` requests don't use Auth or apiKey 
- **For ```bookshelf``` resquests, we use an oAuth 2.0 + API KEY**


#### Routing : ####
Dispatch between data iteration requests, and tests cases works as follows :
- ```Routing Req``` sets next request depending on the ```data.scenario``` value
- ```switch``` statement on ```data.testCase``` in the test script of each request routes the iteration to its corresponding test case.
- Each request after completion and tests throws back to the routing Req.

***
***

item.name: Init

exec: postman.setNextRequest('[S203] Add book to public bookshelf');
postman.setNextRequest('[S292] Add book to private bookshelf');
postman.setNextRequest('[S501a] Get a list of books');

request.description: This is a fake request used for routing purpose.

item.description: Start point folder, contains the ROUTING REQUEST.

item.name: INTEGRATION TESTS
VOLUMES
LIST BOOKS
[S001] CRITICAL

exec: pm.test(`[S001C002] Response object has all expected properties`,() => {

request.description:
### Test Scenario : [S001] Critical Tests ###

|Verb|Description|
|-:|:-|
|```GIVEN```|The Client |
|```WHEN```|I request the service for books with valid endpoint |
|```AND```|The query has no parameter |
|```THEN```|**I should get a valid response** |


### 2 test cases : ###
| [case] | Description | Iteration |
|:-|:-|:-|
| ```[C001]``` | Response has "200" Status code | 1|
| ```[C002]``` | Response object has all expected properties | 1 |

#### datas : #### 
- ```qData```= "arcachon"

item.description: Challenges response status code, format and structure.

item.name: [S002] FILTERS

exec: pm.test(`[SC002C001] Each item has a TITLE including "${data.qData}"`, () => {
pm.test(`[SC002C002] Each item's AUTHORS is an array that includes "${data.qData}"`, () => {
pm.test(`[SC002C003] Response has a uniq item with isbn : "${data.qData}"`, () => {

request.description:
### Test Scenario : [S002] Valid request format with q parameter ### |Verb|Description| |-:|:-| |```GIVEN```|The Client | |```WHEN```|I request the service for books with valid endpoint | |```AND```|"q" is set with a filter | |```THEN```|**I should get a valid response with items matching "q" filter constraints** | ### 3 test cases : ### | CASE | Description | iteration | Datas | |-|-|-|-| | ```[C001]``` | ```intitle``` check: Each item has a TITLE including the requested value | 1 | ```qScope```="intitle"
```qData```="arcachon" | | ```[C002]``` | ```inauthor``` check: Each item's AUTHORS is an array that includes the requested value | 1 | ```qScope```="inauthor"
```qData```="arcachon" | | ```[C003]``` | ```isbn``` check: Response has a uniq item with matching "isbn" | 1 | ```qScope```="isbn"
```qData```="9781428925168" |

item.description: Challenges responses to requests with "q" filtered values.

item.name: [S003-7] PARAMETERS

exec: pm.test(`[S003C001] Response is valid when parameter orderBy is set to "${data.orderBy}"`, () => {
const date = new Date (dateArray[0], dateArray[1] ? dateArray[1] - 1: 0, dateArray[2]? dateArray[2].substring(0,2):1).getTime()
pm.test(`[S003C002] Response items are sorted from newest to oldest`, () => {

request.description:
### Test Scenario : [S003] Valid request format with ```orderBy``` parameters ### |Verb|Description| |-:|:-| |```GIVEN```|The Client | |```WHEN```|I request the service for books with valid endpoint | |```AND```|```orderBy``` parameter is set with a valid value | |```THEN```|**I should get a valid response with items sorted accordingly** | ### 2 test cases : ### | CASE | Description | iteration | Datas | |-|-|-|-| | ```[C001]``` | Response is valid with ```orderBy``` = "relevance" | 1 | ```qData```="balloon"
```orderBy'```="relevance" | | ```[C002]``` | Response items are sorted from newest to latest with ```orderBy``` = "newest" | 1 | ```qData```="balloon"
```orderBy'```="newest" |

### Test Scenario : [S004] Valid request format with ```maxResults``` parameters ### |Verb|Description| |-:|:-| |```GIVEN```|The Client | |```WHEN```|I request the service for books with valid endpoint | |```AND```|```maxResults``` parameter is set with a valid value | |```THEN```|**I should get a valid response with a number of items matching accordingly** | ### 2 test cases : ### | [case] | Description | Iteration | Datas | |-|-|-|-| | ```[C001]``` | Response has a count of at least ```maxResults``` items | 1/2 | ```qData```="arcachon"
```maxResults```= 20 | | | | 2/2 | ```qData```="arcachon"
```maxResults```= 40 | | ```[C002]``` | Response has 0 item | 1/1 | ```qData```="arcachon"
```maxResults```= 0 |

exec: pm.test(`[S005C001] Results are offset accordingly to "startIndex" value`, () => {

request.description:

```startIndex```= 1 |

exec: pm.test(`[S007C001] Response returns items with language "${data.langRestrict}"`, () => {

request.description:
### Test Scenario : [S007] Valid request format with ```langRestrict``` parameter ### |Verb|Description| |-:|:-| |```GIVEN```|The Client | |```WHEN```|I request the service for books with valid endpoint | |```AND```|```langRestrict``` parameter is set with a valid value| |```THEN```|**I should get a valid response with items that has a ```language```value matching the requested parameter** | ### 1 test case : ### | [case] | Description | Iteration | Datas | |-|-|-|-| | ```[C001]``` | Response is valid and each item's ```language``` value matches the input parameter| 1/3 | ```qData```="arcachon"

item.description: This folder contains all Error responding requests for bookshelves
This folder contains all tests challenging **BOOKSHELF**

### This folder contains a set of INTEGRATION TESTS on : ###

- **VOLUMES** :
    - LIST BOOKS : requests for several books [S001] to [S099]
    - GET BOOK : request for a specific book [101] to [S199]
- **BOOKSHELVES** :
    - requests to GET and MANIPULATE bookshelves [S201] to [299]

Each request has a performance test challenging response speed, and format :

### TEST SCENARIO : [S00Time] Response Time
|Verb|Description|
|-:|:-|
|```GIVEN```|The Client |
|```WHEN```|I request the service |
|```AND```|And my endpoint is valid |
|```THEN```|**I should get a response in less than 400ms** |

### TEST SCENARIO : [S00json] response format is JSON
|Verb|Description|
|-:|:-|
|```GIVEN```|The Client |
|```WHEN```|I request the service |
|```AND```|And my endpoint is valid |
|```THEN```|**I should get a response in JSON format** |

item.name: REGRESSION TESTS
[S501] : list books, then pick one

exec: pm.test("[S201aC002] Response Content-Type is present and is JSON",() => {
pm.test(`[S201aC003] Response object has all expected properties`,() => {
pm.test(`[S201aC005] Each item of response has an "id" property`, () => {
pm.test(`[S201aC006] Each item of response has a "language" property set to "${data.lang}"`, () => {
pm.test(`[S201aC007] Each item's AUTHORS is an array that includes "${data.expected.author}"`, () => {
const date = new Date (dateArray[0], dateArray[1] ? dateArray[1] - 1: 0, dateArray[2]? dateArray[2].substring(0,2):1).getTime()
pm.test(`[S201aC008] Response items are sorted from newest to oldest`, () => {

request.description:
### Test Scenario : [S501a] Get a list of books ### |Verb|Description| |-:|:-| |```GIVEN```|The Client | |```WHEN```|I request the service for books with valid endpoint| |```AND```|I search for a book in FRENCH | |```AND```|I want the author to be "CÃ©line Minard" | |```AND```|I want the 5 most recent publications | |```THEN```|**I should get a valid response matching the requirements** | ### 3 test cases : ### | [case] | Description | Iteration | |:-|:-|:-| | ```[C001]``` | Response has "200" Status code | 1| | ```[C002]``` | Response has headers with content-type "JSON" | 1 | | ```[C003]``` | Response is an object,
has ```kind``` property with value "books#volumes",
and has "totalItems" property with value above 0. | 1 | | ```[C004]``` | Response has ```Ã¬tems```property, which is an array of ```maxResults``` objects | 1 | | ```[C005]``` | Each item has an ```Ã¬d``` | 1 | | ```[C006]``` | Each item has an ```language``` = ```lang``` | 1 | | ```[C007]``` | Each item has an ```author``` property which is an array that contains ```qData```| 1 | | ```[C008]``` | Items are sorted by ```publishedDate```| 1 | #### Datas : #### - ```qScope```= "inauthor" - ```qData```="CÃ©line Minard" - ```maxResults```="5" -```lang```="fr" -```orderBy```="newest"

exec: pm.test("[S501bC001] Response id matches request id",() => {
pm.test("[S501bC003] Response image link is valid and pointing to an image",() => {
pm.test("[S201bC004] Response preview link is valid and pointing to an html page",() => {
pm.test("[S201bC005] Response info link is valid and pointing to an html page",() => {

request.description:

request to this url returns a 200 code with "image" as content-type | 1 | | ```[C004]``` | Response has ```previewLink```parameter that contains an url string,
request to this url returns a 200 code with "html" as content-type | 1| | ```[C005]``` | Response has ```infoLink```parameter that contains an url string,
request to this url returns a 200 code with "html" as content-type | 1 | **Datas :** - ```bookId```= "B3hOv6y9_dcC" - ```bookshelfId```= 1001

item.description:
#### [S501] : As the client I want to list books, then pick one in order to retrieve informations aubout it. ####

It is made of 2 sub scenarios :
- [S501a]
- [S502b]

| [case] | Description | Iteration |

| ```[C002]``` | Response has no content | 1 |

exec: pm.test(`[S502gC002] total Items of bookshelf is back to ${initialTotalItemsOfBookshelf}`, ()=> {

request.description:
### 3 test cases : ###
| [case] | Description | Iteration |
|:-|:-|:-|
| ```[C001]``` | Response has "200" Status code | 1|
| ```[C002]``` | Response has totalItems back to [S502b] value | 1 |
| ```[C003]``` | Response has no longer an item of id "B3hOv6y9_dcC"| 1 |

item.description:
This scenario challenges a use case where the service is requested for a bookshelf, a book is added to it, then consulted, then retrieved.

### Test Scenario : [S502a] Empty test bookshelf ###

|Verb|Description|
|-:|:-|
|```GIVEN```|The Client |
|```WHEN```|I request the service to consult, and manipulate my bookshelf|
|```THEN```|**I should get a valid responses reflecting my actions** |

#### Datas : ####
- ```bookshelfId```= "1001"
- ```bookId```="B3hOv6y9_dcC"

### This folder contains a set of REGRESSION TESTS on specific Use Cases : ###

- **Use Case 1 :** As the client I want to request for 1 book out of a book list I requested, in order to get informations about this book. [S201]

Each request has a performance test challenging response speed, and format :

### TEST SCENARIO : [S00Time] Response Time
|Verb|Description|
|-:|:-|
|```GIVEN```|The Client |
|```WHEN```|I request the service |
|```AND```|And my endpoint is valid |
|```THEN```|**I should get a response in less than 400ms** |

### TEST SCENARIO : [S00json] response format is JSON
|Verb|Description|
|-:|:-|
|```GIVEN```|The Client |
|```WHEN```|I request the service |
|```AND```|And my endpoint is valid |
|```THEN```|**I should get a response in JSON format** |

exec: pm.test("[S201bC002] Content-Type is present and is JSON",() => {
pm.test(`[S201bC003] Response object has all expected properties`,() => {
pm.test("[S201bC004] Response id matches request id",() => {
pm.test("[S201bC006] Response image link is valid and pointing to an image",() => {
pm.test("[S201bC007] Response preview link is valid and pointing to an html page",() => {
pm.test("[S201bC008] Response info link is valid and pointing to an html page",() => {
